programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood joins the US Army's First Armoured Division, travelling into the desert to take part in a field exercise testing the combat readiness of troops and weaponry.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The presenters follow the development progress of properties sold at auction in Blairgowrie in Perth and Kinross, Fenton in Stoke-on-Trent and Chatham in Kent.

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A car scam backfires badly when investigators spot the tell-tale signs and a fraudster claims for a damaged watch that is flagged as being stolen. Presented by Naga Munchetty.

programme.title: Ill Gotten Gains
programme.desc: Police in Wales track down crime gangs selling drugs out of suburban homes, and a luxury yacht, once a criminal's pride and joy, is now up for sale at a proceeds-of-crime auction.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Thomas Plant and Nick Hall help two teams scour Nottingham racecourse for items, while presenter Charlie Ross tests people's knowledge of hallmarks.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: The new practice manager starts work amid much confusion. Jimmi searches for a new car and Ruhma deals with a woman whose superstitions are troubling her in the build-up to a birth.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The Roman Catholic priest spies trouble when Lady Felicia returns to Kembleford from Africa, having split from her lover Benedict Northam. Mark Williams stars.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley heads on a house hunting mission in rural Devon for a couple who are looking for their first home together, with a budget of £525,000

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore turns to Neil Wragg to come up with a creative new use for an old kitesurfing sail, while the Bristol Upholstery Collective is tasked with turning a forlorn futon into something fabulous. Sarah also takes on the ambitious project of transforming a wine bottle into lighting.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The restorers get to work on a satchel owned by a prisoner of war, a pub clock with an intriguing past and a sea-serpent pen holder. Presented by Jay Blades.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Angellica Bell.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ben's conscience kicks in when he realises how much Martin hates working for him, Gray tells Chantelle he is scared she will leave him and Max is humiliated when a customer at the club assumes he is Ruby's dad. Karen railroads Billy into giving her a job at the E20 and Jack steps in when a situation gets out of hand in a courtroom, oblivious to the identity of the man he has arrested.

programme.title: Inside the Supermarket
programme.desc: There is excitement in the air as the Sainsbury's staff prepare for a party to celebrate the supermarket's 150th year of trading, especially as the Queen will be there. After 50 years' service on the tills, Jenny from the Wallington store has been selected to meet Her Royal Highness and she cannot wait. As the supermarket celebrates its past, it also looks to the future by trialling an experiment to remove all the checkouts from one store, encouraging customers to pay with their mobiles. Will it change the face of shopping or simply send customers elsewhere?.

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Actor Danny Dyer wants to know more about his tough working-class family in the East End of London and hopes his history will 'freak a few people out'. But he gets more than he bargained for when he unearths an extraordinary lineage stretching back to the 11th century.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Bolton, Greater Manchester. The panellists are Conservative Housing Secretary Robert Jenrick, Labour Shadow Lord Chancellor Richard Burgon, Liberal Democrat Foreign Affairs spokesperson Chuka Umunna, SNP health spokesperson Phillipa Whitford and Daily Telegraph columnist Sherelle Jacobs.

programme.title: Brexitcast
programme.desc: A mix of light-hearted gossip and serious analysis about the process to leave the EU - and no doubt the forthcoming General Election - with Laura Kuenssberg, Katya Adler, Adam Fleming and Chris Mason.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dom helps track down fugitives with a bounty on their heads as he works as a private investigator in Waco, Texas. His mentor is James Fullner, a private investigator who's spent 15 years in the business, exposing cheating partners and business fraud, and apprehending fugitives on the run. Working alongside an armed team of investigators, on behalf of a local bail bondsman, they hit the streets in pursuit of a violent fugitive, a runaway drug addict and a wanted sex offender.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The development progress of a flat in Folkestone, Kent and a house in Earby, Lancashire, as well as a revisit to a West Midlands commercial premises first featured in 2016.

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A jewellery lover with form loses her sparkle when the companies she targets identify multiple scams, while a hungry hotel guest outstays his welcome by faking an injury. Disaster on the dance floor ends in court with a twinkle-toed claimant in a tangle when CCTV reveals all, and a holidaymaker tries it on with phone scam that just won't fly as records highlight his handset is still up and running. Meanwhile, a chancer staging a car crash fails as he catches himself out with in-car technology. Presented by Naga Munchetty.

programme.title: Ill Gotten Gains
programme.desc: Police aim to put a stop to the drug supply in Derby, and take away any assets and cash that have been made illegally. The RNLI are called out to assist a yacht in distress - but end up alerting Border Force after it refuses to be rescued. Presented by Angellica Bell and Rav Wilding.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Sandown Park racecourse, where experts Raj Bisram and Catherine Southon help two teams acquire items of value to sell on for a profit. Before the excitement of the auction, Eric meets a group of students and their treasured vintage fire engine, Jezebel.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Bear starts feeling the pressure of the job, while Gareth has a suggestion for Al. Rob investigates a murder, and Emma throws some new light on the investigation.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Mallory is forced to turn to the sleuthing priest for help when a senior member of the police force is murdered at a bowls match. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton is on a house-hunting mission with a dynamic couple in the Herefordshire countryside, hoping they fall in love with the homes they see for their £565,000 budget. Along the way, the presenter heads to the banks of the River Wye to gets to grips with paddle boarding, an ever growing low-impact water sport.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Upcycling entrepreneur Sarah Moore salvages three skip-bound items from the recycling centre in Witley. To help her give them a new lease of life, Bristol Upholstery Collective gets busy with a box of patchwork pieces, and furniture restyler Emma Walker is challenged with putting her stamp on a dull dressing table. Sarah gives new life to a doll's house in her own project, but will she be able to find new homes for all her items?.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Metalworker Dominic Chinea is delighted to work on a 1950s toy bike gifted to the owner's brother by comedy duo Laurel and Hardy, during a performance in their home town. The pedals have seized up and rust has taken hold of the body work. Other items worked on include a pair of beloved boxing gloves and a shattered ostrich egg cigarette box. Presented by Jay Blades.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce introduces debate from Sheffield, with Leader of the Labour Party Jeremy Corbyn, First Minister of Scotland and Leader of the Scottish National Party Nicola Sturgeon MSP, Leader of the Liberal Democrats Jo Swinson and Prime Minister and Leader of the Conservative Party Boris Johnson facing topical questions from an audience. All four of the participants will be keen to impress the voting public ahead of next month's General Election - the first to take place during December since 1923.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Callum is thrilled by Ben's new positive approach to work, and Martin heads to the Slaters but is shocked by what he finds. Max plans to prove to Ruby he is serious about her by proposing, while newlyweds Tiffany and Keegan's dinner party does not go to plan. Karen starts her trial at the E20, where Billy begins to see her in a new light.

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Comedian David Mitchell assumes the role of host, as panellists poke fun at the week's events. Stand-up comedian Maisie Adam and former MP Rory Stewart join regular team leaders Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by racing star Lewis Hamilton, fresh from winning his sixth Formula One world title, and actress Elizabeth Banks, who is co-starring as Susan Bosley in the new Charlie's Angels movie, which she also wrote and directed. Ricky Gervais discusses the world tour of his new stage show, SuperNature, and pop queen Kylie Minogue chats and performs a special version of her hit single Slow and another bunch of intrepid audience members tries to recount an anecdote from the dreaded red chair.

credits.actor: as Susan Bosley in the new Charlie's Angels movie

programme.title: Fleabag
programme.desc: Return of the comedy written by and starring Phoebe Waller-Bridge, following a woman wrestling with the demands of modern living. Fleabag attends an uncomfortable family dinner alongside her sister Claire and brother-in-law Martin, to celebrate her godmother and father's engagement, where she finds herself intrigued by a priest. The evening comes to a tempestuous end however, when an unexpected attack brings old tensions bubbling to the surface. With Bill Paterson, Olivia Colman and Andrew Scott.

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: In the eighth week of the competition, the candidates are challenged to host a corporate away day onboard the iconic Belmond British Pullman Train, arranging food, drinks and entertainment and also securing a good ticket price. The task will require the teams to show off their organisation and hospitality skills as they hope to impress the corporate clients. For one team the journey gets off to a bumpy start, while the others are left red faced when they have to deal with hungry guests. Back in the boardroom, one of the candidates is sent home from the competition.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Rick Stein and Alison Roman, and special guest Ben Miller. Plus, archive clips featuring Rick Stein, Keith Floyd and Nigel Slater.

programme.title: Flour Power
programme.desc: Colleagues Ali, Noura, Davie and Ewan from the Edinburgh branch of the Cyrenians charity compete against one another in a series of baking challenges.

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests review the week's headlines and look ahead to forthcoming fixtures, including Manchester City v Chelsea in the Premier League.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross hosts from the British Motor Museum in Gaydon, Warwickshire, where experts Richard Madley and Thomas Plant help two teams pick up items to sell on at auction for the highest profit possible. Prior to heading to the auction in Lichfield, Staffordshire, Charlie learns about the military history of Cannock Chase.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore sees what people are about to throw away at Dunbar Recycling Centre, rescuing a set of drawers, an unwanted computer desk and an old accordion case for transformation.

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Property relocation advice programme, beginning as Steve Brown helps a couple feeling the pinch of the London property market to decide on their ideal town and the right home in which to raise their young children by showing them around Knaresborough, North Yorkshire.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steve Fletcher and Kirsten Ramsay restore an art deco lamp, Will Kirk tackles a wooden sea chest and Matthew Nickels completely overhauls a precious stained glass window.

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland.

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a special celebrity edition of the general knowledge quiz, with contestants Rachel Fairburn, Kiri Pritchard-Mclean, Tommy Cannon, Bobby Ball, Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon, Lindsey Russell and Radzi Chinyanganya.

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present the music-based quiz show, in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible under intense pressure, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs for the winners. Across three rounds, their knowledge is put to the test, as they attempt to identify huge hits across various decades. In the second episode, brother and sister Simon and Sarah from Bristol, friends Rita and Angela from London, and grandson and grandad Alex and Steve from Port Talbot in Wales take part.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman return to the Elstree studio after last week's trip to Blackpool, which saw Michelle Visage and Giovanni Pernice leave the contest. As well as the usual ballroom battle, judge Bruno Toniolo will be treating the audience to a rendition of Can't Take My Eyes Off You, accompanied by the a dance number by the professionals.

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Show
programme.desc: The lively comedian returns with his evening entertainment show, recorded in front of an audience at the London Palladium. The first edition features a musical performance by Liam Payne, who performs his latest single, Stack it Up, and survival expert Bear Grylls hands his phone over to the host for Send To All.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The truth about Lev's past makes Ruby feel uncomfortable. Meanwhile, a surprise visit from her mother at the hospital puts Rosa and David's fake relationship to the test, and after dealing with a patient who brings back traumatic memories from the terrorist attack, Ethan decides he needs to get away.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Chelsea at the Etihad Stadium and Crystal Palace v Liverpool at Selhurst Park. Last season's corresponding fixture between the Citizens and Blues ended in a 6-0 rout for the home side, with Sergio Aguero hitting his 11th top-flight hat-trick in the process. Plus, action from Arsenal v Southampton at the Emirates Stadium, Bournemouth v Wolverhampton Wanderers at the Vitality Stadium, Brighton & Hove Albion v Leicester City at the Amex Stadium, Everton v Norwich City at Goodison Park, Watford v Burnley at Vicarage Road and West Ham United v Tottenham Hotspur at London Stadium. With analysis by Alan Shearer and Danny Murphy.

programme.title: The NFL Show
programme.desc: Mark Chapman is joined by former players Osi Umenyiora and Jason Bell to present highlights of Thursday night's game - Houston Texans v Indianapolis Colts at NRG Stadium.

programme.title: What Doesn't Kill You (2008)
programme.desc: Two childhood friends become criminals in the employ of a Boston mobster, leading one to develop a drug habit that nearly costs him his wife and children. After a spell in prison, he resolves to make a fresh start as a devoted family man, but his friend tempts him with the promise of an armoured car robbery. Crime drama, starring Mark Ruffalo, Ethan Hawke and Amanda Peet.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Roger Johnson and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Chelsea at the Etihad Stadium and Crystal Palace v Liverpool at Selhurst Park. Last season's corresponding fixture between the Citizens and Blues ended in a 6-0 rout for the home side, with Sergio Aguero hitting his 11th top-flight hat-trick in the process. Plus, action from Arsenal v Southampton at the Emirates Stadium, Bournemouth v Wolverhampton Wanderers at the Vitality Stadium, Brighton & Hove Albion v Leicester City at the Amex Stadium, Everton v Norwich City at Goodison Park, Watford v Burnley at Vicarage Road and West Ham United v Tottenham Hotspur at London Stadium. With analysis by Alan Shearer and Danny Murphy.

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 10.00

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from the region.

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Ria Hebden present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers.

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Sioned Young and her family embark on a trial week living in Perth, but husband Richard is concerned about the practicalities of such a huge change from their lives in North Wales.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and the teams search for well-priced antiques and collectibles to sell at auction in the streets of Hungerford, Berkshire, with the assistance of experts Philip Serrell and Richard Madley.

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.sub-title: Gospel Choir of the Year 2019 - Part Two
programme.desc: YolanDa Brown hosts the first of two programmes to find the Gospel Choir of the Year, with five amateur groups taking to the stage at Reading Town Hall. They have to impress vocal coach Mark De-Lisser, West End star Brenda Edwards and pop singer Rick Astley, who will pick the winner.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman meets a couple who have already sold up and are desperate to invest £425,000 in their perfect home in Somerset, and also visits Dunkeswell Aerodrome.

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble watch as a gorilla undergoes surgery, while Jean Johansson finds out just how much the baby meerkats have grown when she tries to catch them.

programme.title: Seven Worlds, One Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the wildlife of Australia, a land cast adrift at the time of the dinosaurs and Isolated for millions of years, leaving weird and wonderful animals found nowhere else on Earth. In its jungles, a cassowary - one of the most dangerous birds in the world - stands six feet tall, while kangaroos and wombats brave snowstorms, and gum-tree forests are filled with predators. In its red desert heart, reptiles drink through their skin and huge flocks of wild budgerigars swirl in search of water. On secret islands Tasmanian devils roam, and offshore thousands of sharks gather for a rare event..

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker heads to the heart of the Snowdonia National Park to explore its Slate Trail, an 83-mile loop taking in some of the area's least-trodden path, while Ellie Harrison is in the foothills of Llanberis to find about about the Outdoor Partnership. Plus, Tom Heap investigates the impact of falling farm gate prices on the British beef industry.

programme.title: Seven Worlds, One Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the wildlife of Europe, a crowded continent hiding the most surprising animals in pockets of wilderness. Gibraltar Nature Reserve is home to Europe's only wild population of primates, with its Barbary macaques living a life of kidnapping and high drama, while in the cemeteries of Vienna graverobbing European hamsters do battle with one another. Italian mountain villages are the hunting grounds for rarely seen wolves, and lynx lurk in the forests of Spain.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman announce the results, leaving the two couples with the lowest combined scores to take part in a dance-off to decide who will be next to leave the contest. Opera star Andrea Bocelli provides the music.

programme.title: His Dark Materials
programme.desc: Lyra and the Gyptians arrive in the North and seek the help of the Witches' Consul, as well as Texan aeronaut Lee Scoresby and a bear who has been working in a scrapyard for food and board since being tricked out of his armour. Fantasy adventure, starring Dafne Keen and Lin-Manuel Miranda.

programme.title: The War of the Worlds
programme.desc: George searches frantically for Amy, but encounters more capsules and soon realises that the scale of the invasion is beyond his comprehension. Meanwhile, Amy and Frederick are at the Admiralty, looking for George and trying to help organise a response. As the invasion continues, Frederick decides they should go to his summer house in Shoeburyness, and there they head to the beach to try to catch a boat away from Britain. Adaptation of HG Wells' sci-fi classic, starring Rafe Spall, Eleanor Tomlinson and Rupert Graves.

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Sheffield United v Manchester United. Mark Chapman presents action from today's only Premier League fixture, held at Bramall Lane. The Blades have made an impressive start to their first top-flight campaign since the 2006/07 season, and will have been hoping to take the scalp of Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's men, who have struggled on their travels. With analysis by Darren Fletcher and Tim Cahill.

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Reshmin Chowdhury presents highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, including Arsenal v Liverpool at Meadow Park and Bristol City v Manchester City at Stoke Gifford Stadium.

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: This time, Nick Knowles and the team transforms a home in Bromsgrove. Karis, a 28-year-old woman who has cerebral palsy, currently lives with her mother, Karen, but now her own health is deteriorating and it is making caring for Karis almost impossible. The family have decided that Karis should move in with her older sister Jo, but her entire home is inaccessible for Karis, so the team decides to build a large two-storey extension to make the house more suitable. Elsewhere, Billy takes on jousting at Warwick Castle.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass return to tackle more potential miscarriages of justice as they re-examine historic murder cases on behalf of the family of those convicted. In the first edition they investigate their oldest case yet, the murder of a canal boat passenger 180 years ago in which boatmen were convicted and publicly hanged.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts follow the development progress of a tenement flat in Glasgow, a two-bedroom terrace in Birmingham and a house in Swindon.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Counterfeit contact lenses that are not sterile and risk wearers eyesight and the fake website racket that conned innocent Brits out of tens of millions of pounds.

programme.title: A1: Britain's Longest Road
programme.desc: A driver's life hangs in the balance following a serious accident in one of the worst snowstorms in decades, while a passenger panics after getting stuck on an icy embankment.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Gary Pe and Nick Hall give advice to two teams scouring Ardingly in West Sussex for items to sell at auction, where one of Willy Wonka's golden tickets goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Bear wriggles out of a tight corner, Daniel struggles to decide on a new car and Gareth's good mood is punctured. A police officer learns to look beyond her first impressions.

programme.title: The Mallorca Files
programme.desc: DC Miranda Blake is in Palma de Mallorca to escort criminal turned supergrass Niall Taylor back to the UK, but things don't go according to plan. She ends up being paired with wisecracking German detective Max Winter by local police chief Ines Villegas, who authorises the pair to look into Taylor's gang.Crime drama, starring Elen Rhys and Julian Looman.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a woman who wants to move to rural Devon on a £450,000 budget, and also heads to the seaside town of Dawlish to join in with the carnival.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Dave and Harry Rich head to West Sussex, where they come up with ideas for the owners of a narrow garden who want to modernise their space.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team take on a mid-century coffee table, a wind-up panda that holds special family memories and an unusual kitchen utensil in the form of a coconut scraper.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker presents the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.

programme.title: The Andrew Neil Interviews
programme.desc: The broadcaster interviews the leaders of the main parties in the run-up to the General Election.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A hungover Linda backs into another car while taking Ollie to school and drives away, convinced no one has seen. Louise is convinced Lisa is unwell after seeing her medication - but when Keanu tells Sharon, she is left feeling guilty. Ian holds an event to plug his Walford councillor campaign, only for his reputation to be compromised by an unwelcome visitor, and Ben is in high spirits when he manages to help Sonia.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: How to Brainwash a Million People - Panorama
programme.desc: Richard Bilton reports on how China runs its re-education camps, with more than a million people having been locked up in one of the biggest mass detentions in modern history. The investigation uncovers the reality of surveillance and abuse inside hundreds of new detention centres.

programme.title: Meat: A Threat to Our Planet?
programme.desc: Animal biologist Liz Bonnin investigates the environmental impact of animals being raised to supply the world's increasing demand for meat, and looks at efforts reduce the effects. She begins her journey in Texas, on a vast intensive farm with 50,000 cows, which emit huge amounts of methane, an incredibly potent greenhouse gas that is contributing to climate change. At a university in California, she hears of the efforts of scientists to better understand a cow's digestion so that they can reduce methane emissions.

programme.title: The Young Offenders
programme.desc: A day trip in memory of Conor's dad leads the gang to an encounter with a landowner that sparks pandemonium. To add to the chaos a mysterious amount of cash has also appeared, so Mairead and an interfering Billy Murphy jump to conclusions.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor, writer and comedian David Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with stand-up Maisie Adam and former Conservative MP Rory Stewart joining captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by guests including Hunger Games and Pitch Perfect star Elizabeth Banks, playing Susan Bosley in the new Charlie's Angels movie, which she also wrote and directed. Ricky Gervais discusses the world tour of his new stage show, SuperNature, and pop queen Kylie Minogue chats and performs a special version of her hit single Slow and another bunch of intrepid audience members tries to recount an anecdote from the dreaded red chair.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Criminal barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein examine historical murder cases in which those convicted of the crime went to the gallows pleading their innocence.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Martel Maxwell and Dion Dublin take a look around a shell of a property near Wolverhampton, a bungalow near Stratford-upon-Avon, and an end terrace in Manchester.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood and Michelle Ackerley investigate fake car insurance, health supplements which contain none of the active ingredients, and dangerous dog harnesses.

programme.title: A1: Britain's Longest Road
programme.desc: Police officers adopt some clever tactics during the pursuit of a suspected stolen car, and a driver faces a five hour wait after breaking down in freezing conditions.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Richard Madley and Caroline Hawley help two teams scour an antiques fair at the National Botanic Garden of Wales. Christina Trevanion finds out about a curious piece of furniture.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel seems oblivious to Zara and Karen's concern that Bear is burning the midnight oil. Ayesha guilt trips Emma into helping with her latest project, and Al helps a teenager to reveal who has beaten him up. However, fighting back leads only to tragedy.

programme.title: The Mallorca Files
programme.desc: Miranda and Max investigate the disappearance of a champion cyclist while Ines is away - a case that inspires a little sporting rivalry between the two detectives. When the missing man's wife receives a ransom demand, evidence merges of a complex situation involving mistaken identity and murder.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a retired couple find a characterful property in Norfolk, as well as learning about boat building in Wells-next-the-Sea and sailing a traditional yacht.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie and the Rich brothers come up with designs for a large garden in Hemel Hempstead, with owners Carly and Andy keen to tackle an eyesore dating back to the Second World War.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a wooden desk, a scrapbook charting the fantastic story of the owner's grandmother, and a wind-up train that has not run in decades.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Liberal Democrats.

programme.title: The Andrew Neil Interviews
programme.desc: Andrew Neil interviews the party leaders in the run-up to the General Election.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The day of the wife swap competition arrives and Mick is determined everything runs smoothly. However, as everyone gathers excitedly at the Vic to learn the outcome of the competition, an unimpressed Gray sets out to sabotage the results. Jags remembers Chantelle from years before, Honey desperately tries to put Adam off the idea of a holiday and Dotty is desperate to make some money, while Ian seeks help from the Panesar brothers.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Kian is desperate to deliver the surgery that Bea desires, but Jac is too stressed and refuses to help, forcing him to consider what he is willing to sacrifice to give her what she wants. Dom and Lofty are too busy putting others first to deal with their own problems, and Donna distracts herself from her troubles by focussing on a returning patient. But when she goes missing, Donna has to be brave enough to convince them both to face their fears. Guest starring Lorraine Chase (Emmerdale).

programme.title: Gold Digger
programme.desc: Marsha is reunited with Julia on the anniversary of her husband's death, and tries to rebuild their former friendship. However, Benjamin shatters any hope of reconciliation. She is left wondering if her relationship with Ted was worth the price she paid, or if her partner can stand the thought of his ex-wife moving on. Patrick and Della pay their mother a visit, and present her with evidence of Benjamin's indiscretions. She keeps what she knows from him, while plotting to uncover his true motives.

programme.title: Plastic Surgery Undressed
programme.desc: Vogue Williams and Mobeen Azhar report on cosmetic surgery and try to separate fact from fiction. The first episode focuses on nose jobs, and gives four people considering the procedure a glimpse of the process by letting them watch a surgeon operate on a patient. Each of the viewers is accompanied by a friend or family member, who have their own opinions over whether this is a good idea.

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Show
programme.desc: The lively comedian hosts an evening of entertainment, recorded in front of an audience at the London Palladium. The first edition features a musical performance by Liam Payne, who performs his latest single, Stack it Up, and survival expert Bear Grylls hands his phone over to the host for Send To All.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Criminal barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein examine the case of a poultry farmer who was hanged for the murder of his wife, after her body was found buried under a chicken run.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore properties about to be auctioned in Tylorstown, South Wales, Rainham, Kent and Crewe in Cheshire.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: A report on the fake alcohol being served to British holiday makers in Greece. Plus, the children's toys that may contain gender altering chemicals.

programme.title: A1: Britain's Longest Road
programme.desc: An overturned lorry forces the closure of the road to Edinburgh. Meanwhile, emergency services battle to quell a devastating van fire which refuses to die down.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents as a team of gym enthusiasts take on a punk rock singer and an actress at Lincoln Antiques Fair, with help from experts Raj Bisram and Kate Bliss.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ayesha and Bear try to convince Emma to lead their 'Smears Without Fears' campaign. Meanwhile, Daniel's therapy session forces him to confront an old demon.

programme.title: The Mallorca Files
programme.desc: Miranda and Max attempt to find a masked assailant who stole the famous Icon of St Nicholas, but the escape of a person of interest results in a furious Ines removing the pair from the case, causing a rift between the two detectives. When the icon suddenly reappears, Miranda and Max must put their differences aside as they are drawn into a furious cat-and-mouse chase.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A military couple seek a Shropshire home for their £500,000 budget, so Jonnie Irwin goes house hunting with the duo, and also meets a master bike frame builder.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich are challenged to come up with a Mughal-inspired design for a tiny garden in Harrow.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Three treasured family heirlooms are brought back to life, including a collectable seesaw, a hand stitched bedspread and a gentlemen's shooting stick.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Labour Party.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio. Presented by Matt Baker.

programme.title: The Andrew Neil Interviews
programme.desc: The broadcaster interviews the leaders of the main parties in the run-up to the General Election.

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team transforms a home in Bolton, Lancashire for the Taylor-Mann family, making the house more suitable for nine-year-old William, who has severe autism. Williams's condition means that he is extremely hypersensitive to noise, and being in close proximity to his siblings is often just too much for him to bear. Nick Knowles and the team, with the help of kind volunteers, transform the property to create a quiet, calm space that can help William feel as comfortable as possible.

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: This week, the candidates travel to the world-famous BBC Maida Vale Studios in West London, where Lord Sugar informs them that for their latest challenge, they are to become managers for musicians. The teams must audition unsigned artists before choosing which one to represent. They will then head to the studio to create a brand-new remix of one of their tracks, aiming to secure sales of the record at their own showcase events. Back in the boardroom, one of the contestants is sent home from the competition.

programme.title: The Man Who Saw Too Much
programme.desc: At 106, Boris Pahor is the oldest living survivor of a Nazi concentration camp. He discusses life and death at Natzweiler, where almost half the prisoners died. Alan Yentob visits Pahor at his home in Trieste, where he talks about his fight against fascism and the Nazis.

programme.title: Earth from Space
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, cameras in space show that the surface of the Earth is changing at a rapid pace as cities grow, forests disappear and glaciers melt. In ever growing grey of cities one man is feeding thousands of parakeets, while in Sumatra, a female orangutan and her daughter face life in a forest under threat. Elsewhere in Tanzania, local people use satellites to re-plant a forest, securing the future for a family of chimpanzees.
